content.rendered:
PROUDLY PRESENTING

TOKAMAK STAND

In April 2017, as part of an extensive renovation at the Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Dymech Engineering was hired to produce a structural steel stand for the Museum’s Tokamak fusion reactor. This reactor was a Canadian-made prototype that progressed the research of thermonuclear fusion in the 1980’s. The reactor, which is approximately 15,000 lbs, needed to be confidently supported and secure, 8 ft high above the Museum’s exhibit floor. Dymech Engineering designed this structure to mount to the existing connections around the reactor, and to demonstrate an industrial and manufacturing theme that is similar to other elements of the exhibit. Dymech also installed the structure and assisted with the placement of the Tokamak reactor.

2273
